intro: Conophytum hillii, commonly known as the rock rose, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, triangular leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and yellow during the summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Conophytum hillii is well adapted to arid environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops.
